attributes.region: Volantis'''Maegyr''' is an old family name in Volantis.<ref>"The Old Gods and the New"</ref>"Maegyr" is pronounced "My-gear".<ref>"The Old Gods and the New"</ref>==Members==*Queen Talisa Maegyr
attributes.title: Maegyr family

sections.Behind the scenes: During rewrites, Robb Stark's romantic interest beganÂ to get anÂ increasinglyÂ different backstory than in the novels. [[George R.R. Martin]] himself suggested the name Maegyr as an old Volantene name to accommodate the changes from his source novels.<ref>Ryan, Maureen (September 4, 2012). [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/04/game-of-thrones-season-3-characters_n_1854918.html 'Game of Thrones' Season 3 Characters And Scoop From Creator George R.R. Martin]. Huffington Post.</ref>Â Talisa's backstory does not include how, or even if, she is related to the same Maegyr family written about in the novels.
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Malaquo Maegyr is one of the [[Triarch]]s of Volantis, the city's three rulers. Triarchs like Malaquo Maegyr are elected from amongst those noble families who can prove unbroken descent from [[old Valyria]]. Malaquo Maegyr is a "Tiger," from the "Old Bloods" political faction who favor more resource allocation into preparing for war. Fittingly, the sigil next to the onscreen credit for [[Oona Chaplin]]Â in the opening titles, who portrays [[Talisa Maegyr]], is two tigers circling one another.
